text: Family Gathering is a 1988 American short documentary film by Lise Yasui, exploring three generations of her Japanese-American family, from their immigration to Oregon in the early 20th century through their imprisonment in internment camps during World War II. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Short. ==Cast== * Keith Hamilton Cobb as Felix (flashback sequence) (uncredited) ==References== ==External links== * *Family Gathering at the Center for Asian American Media Category:1988 films Category:1988 documentary films Category:1988 short films Category:American Experience Category:American films Category:American documentary films Category:American independent films Category:English-language films Category:Autobiographical documentary films Category:Documentary films about immigration to the United States Category:Documentary films about the internment of Japanese Americans Category:Documentary films about families Category:Short documentary films
title: Family Gathering
